reg_pit.title: Provincial Court (Child, Family and Community Service Act) Rules

change.changenote: Definitions section, definition of "party", paragraph (d) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 49/2019, effective March 11, 2019.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: party includes, for the purposes of these rules and section 23 of the Act, anyone the court decides is a party and any of the following who has an address for service:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the director responsible for the child;
a designated representative of an Indian band or of an aboriginal community entitled to notice under section 38 (1) (c) or (d) of the Act;
a designated representative of the Nisg̱a'a Lisims Government entitled to notice under section 38 (1) (c.1) of the Act;

change.changenote: Definitions section BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Act means the Child, Family and Community Service Act;
clerk means a member of the registry staff;
court means the Provincial Court except where the Act or these rules provide otherwise;
party, with respect to a proceeding under the Act, means a person who, under the Act, is a party to that proceeding;
registry means a registry of the court;
other words and expressions have the meaning given to them in the Act, unless the context indicates otherwise.

change.changenote: Interpretation section was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 1 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: To apply for an order, other than an order made at a presentation hearing, a person must complete and file with the court an Application for an Order (Form 2), unless a judge permits otherwise.

change.changenote: Rule 1 (6) (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An application in Form 2 or Form 3 must be filed

change.changenote: Rule 1 (7) BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A judge may conduct a hearing or part of a hearing by telephone in appropriate circumstances.

change.changenote: Rule 1 (8) (b.1) was added by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 1 (9) (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: To apply for an order to be made under subrule (8), a person must file

change.changenote: Rule 1 (10) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 1 (11) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 2 (1) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If at the commencement of a protection hearing under section 40 of the Act

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a consent order is not made, and
the judge determines that the matter cannot be heard that day,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: the judge must direct the parties and their lawyers to attend a case conference.

change.changenote: Rule 2 (2) (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A judge may at any other time direct the parties and their lawyers to attend a case conference

change.changenote: Rule 2 (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: When a judge directs a case conference under subrule (1), the judge must review the extent of disclosure made and requested under section 64 of the Act and may make any order for disclosure consistent with the Act.

change.changenote: Rule 2 (4) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: When a case conference is directed, the director must notify the other parties of the date, time and place of the conference, unless the conference was directed when the parties or their lawyers were present.

change.changenote: Rule 2 (5) (p.1) was added by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 2 (6) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If a judge directs the parties to attend a mini-hearing, a clerk must notify them of the date, time and place, unless the date was set when the parties or their lawyers were present.

change.changenote: Rule 2 (9) BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The chief judge may direct

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that case conferences be conducted in identified court registries by telephone, and
that case conferences set at one place be conducted at another place.

change.changenote: Rule 3 (1) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: serve a copy of the subpoena on the witness personally at least 2 days before the date the witness is required to appear. (See Rule 8 (2))

change.changenote: Rule 3 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: At the time the subpoena is served, the party subpoenaing the witness must offer the witness reasonable estimated travelling expenses.

change.changenote: Rule 3 (2.1) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 3 (2.2) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 3 (3) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: bring to court any records and other things required by the subpoena.

change.changenote: Rule 3 (4) BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A person who is served with a subpoena may apply under Rule 1 (2) to a judge, who may cancel the subpoena if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is not needed as a witness,
it would be a hardship for the person to appear in court as required by the subpoena, or
in the case of a child witness, the judge considers that it would not be in the child's best interests to require the child to testify.

change.changenote: Rule 3 (5.1) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 3 (8) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: order a sheriff or peace officer to detain the witness in custody until his or her presence is no longer required.

change.changenote: Rule 4 (3) BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 49/2019, effective March 11, 2019.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subrule (2) applies also if a designated representative of an Indian band, an aboriginal community or the Nisg̱a'a Lisims Government is served with an application and a representative of that band, that community or the Nisg̱a'a Lisims Government does not appear in court on the date and at the time and place set for the hearing.

change.changenote: Rule 5 (4) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a copy of the affidavit is served on everyone who is entitled to notice of the hearing. (See Rule 8 (2))

change.changenote: Rule 6 (0.1) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 6 (3) (b.1) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 49/2019, effective March 11, 2019.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the application is for a warrant issued under section 28 (3.3) or 98 (4.3) of the Act,

change.changenote: Rule 6 (4) (c) and (d) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 212/2015, effective November 28, 2016.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on a society incorporated under the Society Act

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by registered mail to the address for service on file with the Registrar of Companies, or
by leaving a copy at that address or with a director or officer of the society;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on a company incorporated under the Company Act

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by registered mail to the registered office of the company, or

by leaving a copy of it at the address or with a director or officer of the company, or with a receptionist or a person at the company's place of business who appears to manage the company's business there;

change.changenote: Rule 6 (4) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 49/2019, effective March 11, 2019.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on a designated representative of an Indian band, an aboriginal community or the Nisg̱a'a Lisims Government by facsimile transmission to the facsimile number for service provided by the Indian band, aboriginal community or the Nisg̱a'a Lisims Government, or by leaving a copy with that representative.

change.changenote: Rule 6 (4) BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Documents required by the Act or these rules to be served may be served as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on an individual

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by leaving a copy with him or her,
if the individual is a party, by registered mail or facsimile transmission to the last address for service given under subrule (5), (6) or (7), or
if the individual is a party who has a lawyer of record, by leaving a copy at, or by facsimile transmission to, that lawyer's office;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on a designated representative of a First Nation, an Indigenous community, a Treaty First Nation or the Nisg̱a'a Lisims Government by facsimile transmission to the facsimile number for service provided by the First Nation, Indigenous community, Treaty First Nation or Nisg̱a'a Lisims Government or by leaving a copy with the designated representative;
on a society within the meaning of the Societies Act

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by registered mail to the mailing address of the society's registered office on file with the Registrar of Companies, or
by leaving a copy at the delivery address of the society's registered office on file with the Registrar of Companies or with a director or officer of the society;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on a company within the meaning of the Business Corporations Act

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by registered mail to the mailing address of the company's registered office on file with the Registrar of Companies, or

by leaving a copy of it at the delivery address of the company's registered office on file with the Registrar of Companies or with a director or officer of the company, or with a receptionist or a person at the company's place of business who appears to manage the company's business there;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on an unincorporated association

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by registered mail to the registered office of the association, or
by leaving a copy with an officer of the association;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on a director

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by leaving a copy with or facsimile transmission to the director's lawyer of record, or
by leaving a copy at, or by facsimile transmission to, the district office with conduct of the case.

change.changenote: Rule 6 (8) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Any document may be served on a child who is 12 years of age or older by leaving a copy of it with him or her, unless a judge orders otherwise.

change.changenote: Rule 6 (10) (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If a document cannot be served as provided in these rules or if the person to be served is temporarily outside the Province, a party may apply to a judge who may

change.changenote: Rule 6 (11) (d) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 49/2019, effective March 11, 2019.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for service by facsimile transmission, a Certificate of Service (Form 9) with a transmission report generated by the sending machine.

change.changenote: Rule 6 (11) (b) and (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for service by registered mail, a certificate of service (Form 9), with the original acknowledgment of receipt card;
for personal service on a lawyer, a copy of the document signed by the lawyer or an articled student or by a partner or employee of the firm;

change.changenote: Rule 6 (11) (e) was added by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 6 (11.01) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, as amended by BC Reg 270/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 6 (11.02) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 6 (11.03) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 6 (11.1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 49/2019, effective March 11, 2019.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Judge may require copy of served document
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A judge may require that a copy of the served document be attached to the Certificate of Service (Form 9).

change.changenote: Rule 7 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The director's lawyer prepares the order as soon as practicable, unless the judge orders otherwise.

change.changenote: Rule 7 (3) BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 109/2013, effective March 18, 2012.

subrule.subruletext: Orders must be prepared in Form 10.

change.changenote: Rule 7 (4) BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An order must be signed as approved by the lawyer for each party who was represented, unless the judge orders otherwise.

change.changenote: Rule 7 (7) (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to the lawyer for each party who was represented, and

change.changenote: Rule 8 (4) BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Effective June 3, 1996, a hearing may be adjourned only with the permission of a judge.

change.changenote: Rule 8 (5) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Spent.

change.changenote: Rule 8 (8) (e) was added by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 8 (15) BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Only the following are entitled to search a registry file respecting a matter under the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a party;
a party's lawyer;
a person authorized by a party, by a party's lawyer or by a judge.

change.changenote: Rule 8 (20) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 8 (21) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 8 (22) was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Rule 9, subrules (1) to (11), was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, as amended by BC Reg 270/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Appendix A, Form 1 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 49/2019, effective March 11, 2019.

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext:
In the Provincial Court of British Columbia
Under the Child, Family and Community Service Act

oasis:entry.oasis:line: In the matter of the child(ren):
The parent(s) of the child(ren) is/are:

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: This Information is filed on behalf of a director by:
The child remains in the parents' care and the director applies for supervision under
s. 29.1 (The director has reasonable grounds to believe the child needs protection and a supervision order would be adequate to protect the child.)
The child was removed under the authority of the Child, Family and Community Service Act, under
s. 30 (The director has reasonable grounds to believe the child needs protection AND
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: the child's health or safety is in immediate danger, OR
no less disruptive available measure is adequate to protect the child.)
bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: s. 36 (1) (The director has reason to believe that an order made under s. 33.2 (2), 35 (2) (b) or (d) or 36 (3) no longer protects the child or a person has not complied with a term or condition of the order and a director is required to remove the child.)

s. 42 (The director has reason to believe that an order made under s. 41 (1) (a) or (b), 41 (1.1) or (2.1), 42.2 (4) (a) or (c), 46 (3) or 49 (8) or an interim order made under section 42.1 no longer protects the child or a person has not complied with a term or condition of the order and a director is required to remove the child.)
The child has or has not been returned to the parent.
will be available at the presentation hearing:
The child is aboriginal: Yes No
Previous proceedings involving this child or siblings: Yes No

change.changenote: Appendix A, Form 1 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Appendix A, Form 2 additions under FOR: by BC Reg 109/2013, effective March 18, 2013.
Appendix A, Form 2 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 49/2019, effective March 11, 2019.

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext:
In the Provincial Court of British Columbia
Under the Child, Family and Community Service Act

oasis:entry.oasis:line: In the matter of the child(ren):
The parent(s) of the child(ren) is/are:

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: The child is aboriginal: [ ] Yes [ ] No
[ ] A temporary custody order (under [ ] s. 41 (1) (c), [ ] s. 42.2 (4) (b) or [ ] s. 49 (7) (b))
[ ] A supervision order (under [ ] s. 41 (1) (a), [ ] s. 41 (2.1), or [ ] s. 42.2 (4) (a))
[ ] A continuing custody order (under [ ] s. 41 (1) (d), [ ] s. 42.2 (4) (d), [ ] s. 49 (4), [ ] s. 49 (5) or [ ] s. 49 (10))
[ ] An order permitting use of another service method, as set out below (Rule 6 (10))
[ ] A supervision order after expiry of a temporary custody order (section 46)
[ ] An order for access to a child (section 55)
[ ] An order that a child or parent undergo a medical or other examination (section 59)
[ ] An order under section 60 with reference to section ............
[ ] An order under section 60 dispensing with a required consent
[ ] An order as set out below
Details of the order requested and the section of the Act or Rule relied upon:

change.changenote: Appendix A, Form 2 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Appendix A, Form 3 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 49/2019, effective March 11, 2019.

oasis:line.in:strong:
APPLICATION TO CHANGE OR
CANCEL AN ORDER

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext:
In the Provincial Court of British Columbia
Under the Child, Family and Community Service Act

oasis:entry.oasis:line: In the matter of the child(ren):
The parent(s) of the child(ren) is/are:

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: The child is aboriginal: Yes No

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the attached order be cancelled; OR
the attached order be changed to do the following:
Since the order was made, circumstances have changed significantly as follows: OR
(if the application is under Rule 8 (6)) The reason for changing or cancelling the order is:

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: I make this application under section 28 section 54 section 57 section 98 Rule 8 (6) section ......

change.changenote: Appendix A, Form 3 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Appendix A, Form 4 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext:
In the Provincial Court of British Columbia
Under the Child, Family and Community Service Act

oasis:entry.oasis:line: In the matter of the child(ren):
The parent(s) of the child(ren) is/are:

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: You have been subpoenaed as a witness by
You must bring the following records and other things to court:

bcl:lefttext.in:strong: What happens if you do not attend?

bcl:form.bcl:indent1: A judge may issue a warrant for your arrest.
If you believe that you are not needed as a witness or it would be a hardship for you to attend court, you may ask a judge to cancel the subpoena.
bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: The amount of $...................... is attached for use as travelling expenses to enable you to come to the court.

change.changenote: Appendix A, Form 6 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext:
In the Provincial Court of British Columbia
Under the Child, Family and Community Service Act

oasis:entry.oasis:line: In the matter of the child(ren):
The parent(s) of the child(ren) is/are:

bcl:lefttext.in:strong: I promise to attend the Provincial Court at:
I am released on these conditions, imposed under Rule 3 (9):

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: My name, address and telephone number as shown on this Release are correct.
I understand that if I do not attend court on the date and time shown, a judge may issue a warrant for my arrest.

change.changenote: Appendix A, Form 8 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext:
In the Provincial Court of British Columbia
Under the Child, Family and Community Service Act

oasis:entry.oasis:line: In the matter of the child(ren):
The parent(s) of the child(ren) is/are:

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: This is my address for service in this matter:

change.changenote: Appendix A, Form 9 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext:
In the Provincial Court of British Columbia
Under the Child, Family and Community Service Act

oasis:entry.oasis:line: In the matter of the child(ren):
The parent(s) of the child(ren) is/are:

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: with a copy of: (List each document served.)
by leaving the copy with him or her personally;
by mailing the copy to him or her by registered mail. Attached and marked as an exhibit to this certificate is:
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: the original acknowledgment of receipt card, marked Exhibit ".........."; or
the unopened envelope returned by Canada Post, marked Exhibit "..........".
bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: by sending the copy by facsimile transmission. Attached and marked as Exhibit ".........." to this certificate is a transmission report generated by the sending machine, confirming transmission to [Number] ...................................... which is the facsimile number of [Name]...........................................................................................................................

change.changenote: Appendix A, Form 10 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext:
In the Provincial Court of British Columbia
Under the Child, Family and Community Service Act

oasis:entry.oasis:line: In the matter of the child(ren):
The parent(s) of the child(ren) is/are:

change.changenote: Form 10.1 was enacted by BC Reg 109/2013, effective March 18, 2013.
Appendix A, Form 10.1 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext:
In the Provincial Court of British Columbia
Under the Child, Family and Community Service Act

oasis:entry.oasis:line:
In the matter of the child(ren):
[Name(s)]
The parent(s) of the child(ren) is/are: [Name(s)]

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: After a hearing at ................................................... [court location] on .................................... [mo/day/yr] where the following people appeared: [Add additional lines as required.]
(if applicable) [ ] By Consent [ ] Without notice to others

(if applicable) [ ] After a hearing at ................................................... [court location] the order dated .................................... [mo/day/yr] is changed as stated below.

[Select one or more of the following provisions, as applicable, complete the selected provision(s) and remove the provision(s) that is/are not selected so that it/they do(es) not appear in the draft order when submitted for filing.]

THIS COURT ORDERS, under [ ] section 28 [ ] section 98 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act, that ............................................................ [full name and date of birth of person prohibited] is prohibited for a period of .................................. from contacting or interfering with or trying to contact or interfere with .................................................................. [full name(s)] or from entering any premises or vehicle, or boarding any vessel, that .................................................................. [full name(s)] attend(s).

THIS COURT ORDERS, under [ ] section 28 [ ] section 98 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act, that ............................................................ [full name and date of birth of person prohibited] is prohibited for a period of .................................. from residing with ......................................................................... [full name(s) of child(ren)] or from entering any premises or vehicle, or boarding any vessel, where ................................................................. [full name(s) of child(ren)] reside(s), including any premises, vehicle or vessel that .................................................................. [full name of person prohibited] owns or has a right to occupy.

THIS COURT ORDERS, under [ ] section 28 [ ] section 98 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act, that ............................................................ [full name and date of birth of person restrained] enter into a recognizance, with or without sureties, in an amount of ..................... .

THIS COURT ORDERS, under [ ] section 28 [ ] section 98 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act, that ............................................................ [full name and date of birth of person restrained] must report to the court [or to ........................................................................ [specify person(s)]] as follows: .................................................................. [specify].

THIS COURT ORDERS, under [ ] section 28 [ ] section 98 of the Child, Family and Community Service Act, that ............................................................ [full name and date of birth of person restrained] produce to the court, or to a person named by the court, .............................................................. [specify documents].

bcl:centertext.in:strong:
DISOBEYING THIS ORDER IS A CRIMINAL OFFENCE UNDER SECTION 127
OF THE CRIMINAL CODE PUNISHABLE BY FINE OR IMPRISONMENT

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: TAKE NOTICE THAT any police officer, including any R.C.M.P. officer having jurisdiction in the province of British Columbia, having reasonable and probable grounds to believe that the person against whom this order is made has contravened a term of this order may take action to enforce the order, whether or not there is proof that the order has been served on the person and, if necessary, may use reasonable force. Enforcement action may include arresting the person against whom this order is made without a warrant in accordance with section 495 of the Criminal Code.

change.changenote: Appendix A, Form 10.2 was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Appendix A, Form 10.3 was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Appendix A, Form 10.4 was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Appendix A, Form 10.5 was enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
Appendix A, Form 11 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 49/2019, effective March 11, 2019.

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext:
In the Provincial Court of British Columbia
Under the Child, Family and Community Service Act

oasis:entry.oasis:line: In the matter of the child(ren):
The parent(s) of the child(ren) is/are:

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: consent to the making of a Consent Order under section 60 with reference to section ............... .
Details of the consent order including any terms or conditions:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the child, 12 years of age and older.
a person who has custody of the child(ren) under section 35 (2) (d) or 41 (1) (b) of the Act.
the designated representative of an Indian band, an aboriginal community or the Nisg̱a'a Lisims Government.
a person made a party under section 39 (4) of the Act.
I have been advised by the Director to consult with independent legal counsel before signing this consent.
I understand the nature and the consequences of this consent.
My consent to the order is voluntary.

change.changenote: Appendix A, Form 11 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 216/2022, effective December 19, 2022.
